case_title: COMMISSIONER OF INCOME TAX, PESHAWAR and others vs Messrs PAKISTAN ELECTRIC FITTINGS MANUFACTURING COMPANY LIMITED
appellant: COMMISSIONER OF INCOME TAX, PESHAWAR and others
respondent: Messrs PAKISTAN ELECTRIC FITTINGS MANUFACTURING COMPANY LIMITED

case_summary.facts: The respondent declared income for the year 1997-98, which was assessed under Section 2(12) of the Income Tax Ordinance, 1979. Appeals within the Income Tax hierarchy and the Tribunal were dismissed. The respondent then filed an appeal before the High Court of Sindh, which converted the appeal into a writ petition and allowed it.
case_summary.issues: The appellant challenged the maintainability of the High Court's decision, arguing that the appeal was time-barred and that the High Court lacked jurisdiction to convert the appeal into a writ petition.
case_summary.decision: The Supreme Court dismissed the appeal, holding that the petition for leave to appeal was not maintainable under Section 137 of the Income Tax Ordinance, 1979, and was also barred by time.

key_points: The High Court converted a time-barred appeal into a writ petition and allowed it.
The Supreme Court ruled that the petition for leave to appeal was not maintainable under Section 137 of the Ordinance.
The appeal was also barred by the 30-day limitation period.
